item.title: Sepsis Misdiagnosis: What Compensation Can Victims Recover in Texas?
item.description: Sepsis is a life-threatening medical emergency that far too often goes misdiagnosed or untreated until it’s too late. When physicians and nurses fail to timely diagnose and treat sepsis, patients can face serious complications including organ failure, amputations, and even death. For families left dealing with the devastating aftermath of sepsis malpractice, the civil justice system may provide an avenue for recovering needed compensation. What is sepsis? Sepsis is the body’s extreme response to an infection.
